intro: Haplanthera speciosa, commonly known as the showy haplanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Haplanthera speciosa is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
